{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3154522,"name":"UnofficialForth","username":"UnofficialForth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unofficialforth/{size}/167902_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-28T17:50:26.802Z","cooked":"

Pretty sure the answer is no (or no with an asterisk), but…

Is there a way to put a dynamic feedforward into a sparkmax?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-02-28T17:50:26.802Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":384,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":1964.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":428441,"topic_slug":"dynamic-feedforward-on-spark-max","display_username":"UnofficialForth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29982,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-feedforward-on-spark-max/428441/1","custom_user_title":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3154535,"name":"Zach Hoegberg","username":"Zaque","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zaque/{size}/257827_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-28T17:54:26.783Z","cooked":"

Not using the on-board PIDF control system. If you calculate your feedforward onboard your RIO along with the rest of the PID, you can apply that output directly to the motor controller, but you obviously lose the advantages of running the control loop off-board.
I was wrong, see below.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-02-28T18:13:02.653Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":144,"readers_count":143,"score":53.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":428441,"topic_slug":"dynamic-feedforward-on-spark-max","display_username":"Zach Hoegberg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20681,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"112 Drive Coach | 111&112 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-feedforward-on-spark-max/428441/2","custom_user_title":"112 Drive Coach | 111&112 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3154538,"name":"Kyle Reeve","username":"kreeve","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kreeve/{size}/187015_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-28T17:55:34.074Z","cooked":"

You can use the F term onboard (gets multiplied by the setpoints in velocity mode), and you can also pass in an arbitrary feedforward term on top of the closed loop output.

Got a code example for this by chance?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-02-28T17:56:13.428Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":26,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":162.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":428441,"topic_slug":"dynamic-feedforward-on-spark-max","display_username":"UnofficialForth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":10385,"username":"kreeve","name":"Kyle Reeve","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kreeve/{size}/187015_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29982,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-feedforward-on-spark-max/428441/4","custom_user_title":"FRC Team 4272 Mentor | World's FLL Emcee","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3154547,"name":"Kyle Reeve","username":"kreeve","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kreeve/{size}/187015_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-28T17:59:47.378Z","cooked":"

mMotor.getPIDController().setReference(positionReference, ControlType.kPosition, 0, arbitraryFeedforwardValue);

By default the arbitrary feedforward values is in volts, not percent output. You can add an extra argument at the end SparkMaxPIDController.ArbFFUnits.kPercentOut to make it all be in percent output

Ah-ha! Ok, that’s why I couldn’t find it, it was called ArbitraryFeedforward, not Dynamic feedforward. In case anyone else finds this, here is the sparkmax docs about it. (as of posting)
